Description: Autoimmune disorder causing inflammation of joints and surrounding tissues
Symptoms: Joint pain, Swelling, Stiffness (especially in the morning), Fatigue, Weakness, Fever, Loss of appetite, Rheumatoid nodules (lumps under the skin)
Medicines: Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs), Disease-modifying antirheumatic drugs (DMARDs), Biologic response modifiers (e.g., TNF inhibitors)

Description: Chronic autoimmune disease affecting various organs and tissues
Symptoms: Joint pain and swelling, Butterfly-shaped rash on face (malar rash), Fatigue, Fever, Chest pain, Sensitivity to sunlight, Mouth or nose sores, Raynaud's phenomenon
Medicines: Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs), Corticosteroids, Antimalarial drugs, Immunosuppressants, Biologic therapies

Description: Autoimmune disease affecting the central nervous system
Symptoms: Fatigue, Numbness or weakness in limbs, Blurred or double vision, Tingling or pain in parts of the body, Impaired coordination or balance, Cognitive changes
Medicines: Corticosteroids (for acute exacerbations), Disease-modifying therapies (Interferons, Glatiramer acetate)

Description: Autoimmune condition causing destruction of insulin-producing cells in pancreas
Symptoms: Increased thirst, Frequent urination, Extreme hunger, Unintended weight loss, Fatigue, Irritability, Blurred vision
Medicines: Insulin therapy (multiple types), Blood sugar monitoring, Oral medications (in some cases)

Description: Autoimmune disorder leading to inflammation and underactivity of the thyroid gland
Symptoms: Fatigue, Weight gain, Cold intolerance, Dry skin and hair, Constipation, Muscle weakness, Joint pain, Heavy or irregular periods (in women)
Medicines: Thyroid hormone replacement therapy (Levothyroxine), Anti-inflammatory medications (for symptom relief)

Description: Autoimmune disorder causing overactivity of the thyroid gland
Symptoms: Hyperthyroidism symptoms: Weight loss, Rapid heartbeat, Nervousness or irritability, Tremors, Sweating, Fatigue, Heat intolerance, Bulging eyes (exophthalmos)
Medicines: Antithyroid medications (Methimazole, Propylthiouracil), Beta-blockers (for symptom relief)

Description: Chronic inflammatory bowel disease affecting the gastrointestinal tract
Symptoms: Diarrhea, Abdominal pain and cramping, Rectal bleeding, Weight loss, Fatigue, Reduced appetite, Fever, Perianal complications (fistulas, abscesses)
Medicines: Aminosalicylates, Corticosteroids, Immunomodulators, Biologic therapies

Description: Chronic inflammatory bowel disease affecting the colon and rectum
Symptoms: Diarrhea (often bloody), Abdominal pain and cramping, Rectal bleeding, Urgency to defecate, Inability to defecate despite urgency, Fatigue, Weight loss
Medicines: Aminosalicylates, Corticosteroids, Immunomodulators, Biologic therapies

Description: Chronic autoimmune condition affecting the skin
Symptoms: Red patches of skin covered with silvery scales, Itching or burning, Thickened or ridged nails, Swollen or stiff joints (psoriatic arthritis), Plaques on scalp
Medicines: Topical corticosteroids, Vitamin D analogs, Retinoids, Biologic therapies

Description: Autoimmune disorder triggered by gluten ingestion, causing damage to the small intestine
Symptoms: Abdominal pain, Diarrhea, Bloating, Gas, Fatigue, Weight loss, Anemia, Osteoporosis, Dermatitis herpetiformis (skin rash)
Medicines: Gluten-free diet (strict avoidance of gluten-containing foods), Nutritional supplements

Description: Lump in breast or armpit, Change in breast size or shape, Nipple changes (inversion, discharge), Skin changes (redness, dimpling), Breast pain, Swollen lymph nodes
Symptoms: Chemotherapy, Hormonal therapy (Tamoxifen, Aromatase inhibitors), Targeted therapy (Herceptin), Radiation therapy

Description: Persistent cough, Chest pain, Hoarseness, Shortness of breath, Coughing up blood, Fatigue, Unintended weight loss, Recurrent respiratory infections
Symptoms: Chemotherapy, Immunotherapy (Checkpoint inhibitors), Targeted therapy (EGFR inhibitors), Radiation therapy, Surgery

Description: Urinary problems (frequent urination, weak urine stream), Blood in urine or semen, Erectile dysfunction, Pain or stiffness in pelvis, Bone pain
Symptoms: Active surveillance (for low-risk cases), Surgery (Prostatectomy), Radiation therapy, Hormonal therapy (Androgen deprivation therapy)

Description: Change in bowel habits (diarrhea or constipation), Blood in stool, Abdominal discomfort or pain, Fatigue, Unintended weight loss, Anemia
Symptoms: Surgery (Colectomy, Proctectomy), Chemotherapy, Targeted therapy (EGFR inhibitors), Immunotherapy (Checkpoint inhibitors), Radiation therapy

Description: Change in size, shape, or color of a mole, New mole or growth on skin, Itching or pain in a mole, Sores that don't heal, Spread of pigment from border of a mole
Symptoms: Surgery (Wide local excision), Immunotherapy (Checkpoint inhibitors), Targeted therapy (BRAF inhibitors), Radiation therapy

Description: Fatigue, Weakness, Pale skin, Frequent infections, Fever, Easy bleeding or bruising, Enlarged lymph nodes or spleen, Bone pain
Symptoms: Chemotherapy, Targeted therapy (Tyrosine kinase inhibitors), Immunotherapy (Monoclonal antibodies), Stem cell transplant

Description: Swollen lymph nodes (usually painless), Fatigue, Fever, Night sweats, Unintended weight loss, Itchy skin, Respiratory symptoms
Symptoms: Chemotherapy, Immunotherapy (Checkpoint inhibitors), Targeted therapy (Monoclonal antibodies), Radiation therapy

Description: Abdominal bloating or swelling, Pelvic pain or pressure, Difficulty eating or feeling full quickly, Urinary urgency or frequency, Fatigue, Back pain
Symptoms: Surgery (Hysterectomy), Chemotherapy, Targeted therapy (PARP inhibitors), Immunotherapy (Checkpoint inhibitors)

Description: Abdominal pain or discomfort, Jaundice (yellowing of skin and eyes), Unintended weight loss, Loss of appetite, Nausea, Fatigue, New-onset diabetes
Symptoms: Surgery (Pancreatectomy), Chemotherapy, Targeted therapy (EGFR inhibitors), Immunotherapy (Checkpoint inhibitors), Radiation therapy

Description: Headaches, Seizures, Nausea and vomiting, Cognitive changes (memory loss, difficulty concentrating), Weakness or paralysis, Vision or speech problems
Symptoms: Surgery (Tumor resection), Chemotherapy, Radiation therapy, Tumor-treating fields therapy (Optune)

Description: Blood in urine, Painful or frequent urination, Back or pelvic pain, Urinary urgency, Unintended weight loss, Fatigue, Bone pain
Symptoms: Surgery (Transurethral resection, Cystectomy), Immunotherapy (Checkpoint inhibitors), Chemotherapy, Radiation therapy

Description: Jaundice, Abdominal pain or swelling, Unintended weight loss, Loss of appetite, Fatigue, Weakness, Nausea and vomiting, White chalky stools
Symptoms: Surgery (Hepatectomy), Liver transplant, Ablation therapy, Embolization, Chemotherapy, Targeted therapy (Sorafenib)

Description: Difficulty swallowing (dysphagia), Pain or discomfort in chest or throat, Unintended weight loss, Chronic cough, Hoarseness, Heartburn
Symptoms: Surgery (Esophagectomy), Chemotherapy, Radiation therapy, Immunotherapy (Checkpoint inhibitors), Targeted therapy (EGFR inhibitors)

Description: Narrowing or blockage of coronary arteries, leading to reduced blood flow to the heart muscle
Symptoms: Chest pain (angina), Shortness of breath, Fatigue, Weakness, Dizziness, Nausea
Medicines: Aspirin, Statins, Beta-blockers, ACE inhibitors, Calcium channel blockers

Description: Death of heart muscle tissue due to blocked blood flow to the heart
Symptoms: Chest pain or discomfort (often radiating to arm, jaw, back, or neck), Shortness of breath, Nausea, Vomiting, Sweating
Medicines: Aspirin, Thrombolytics, Beta-blockers, ACE inhibitors, Statins

Description: Inability of the heart to pump blood effectively
Symptoms: Shortness of breath (especially during physical exertion or when lying flat), Fatigue, Swelling (edema) in legs, ankles, or abdomen, Rapid or irregular heartbeat
Medicines: Diuretics, ACE inhibitors, Beta-blockers, Aldosterone antagonists, Angiotensin receptor blockers

Description: Persistent elevation of blood pressure above normal levels
Symptoms: Headaches, Shortness of breath, Nosebleeds, Flushing, Dizziness, Chest pain (in severe cases)
Medicines: Diuretics, ACE inhibitors, Angiotensin II receptor blockers, Calcium channel blockers, Beta-blockers

Description: Irregular heart rhythm or heartbeat
Symptoms: Palpitations (fluttering or pounding sensation in chest), Chest discomfort, Shortness of breath, Dizziness, Fainting (syncope)
Medicines: Antiarrhythmic medications, Beta-blockers, Calcium channel blockers, Anticoagulants

Description: Narrowing or blockage of arteries supplying blood to extremities
Symptoms: Painful cramping in hip, thigh, or calf muscles after physical activity (claudication), Numbness or weakness in affected limb, Coldness in lower leg or foot
Medicines: Antiplatelet agents (e.g., Aspirin), Statins, Medications to control blood pressure

Description: Buildup of plaque (fatty deposits) in arteries
Symptoms: Chest pain (angina), Shortness of breath, Weakness, Fatigue, Numbness or weakness in limbs, Confusion, Vision problems
Medicines: Statins, Antiplatelet agents (e.g., Aspirin), Beta-blockers, ACE inhibitors, Calcium channel blockers

Description: Disease of the heart muscle, leading to weakened heart function
Symptoms: Shortness of breath, Fatigue, Swelling in legs, ankles, or abdomen, Irregular heartbeats, Dizziness or lightheadedness, Chest pain or pressure
Medicines: ACE inhibitors, Beta-blockers, Diuretics, Anticoagulants, Antiarrhythmic medications

Description: Irregular and often rapid heartbeat originating in the atria
Symptoms: Irregular heartbeats (palpitations), Rapid heartbeat (tachycardia), Weakness, Fatigue, Shortness of breath, Chest pain or discomfort
Medicines: Anticoagulants, Rate control medications (Beta-blockers, Calcium channel blockers), Rhythm control medications (Amiodarone, Flecainide)

Description: Dysfunction or damage to heart valves, affecting blood flow
Symptoms: Shortness of breath, Fatigue, Irregular heartbeat, Swelling in legs or abdomen, Chest pain or pressure, Dizziness or fainting episodes
Medicines: Diuretics, ACE inhibitors, Beta-blockers, Anticoagulants, Heart valve repair or replacement surgery

Description: Inflammation of the inner lining of the heart chambers and valves
Symptoms: Fever, Chills, Fatigue, Weakness, Shortness of breath, Chest pain, Palpitations, Small red or purple spots on skin (petechiae)
Medicines: Antibiotics, Anticoagulants, Surgery (in severe cases)

Description: Inflammation of the pericardium (the sac surrounding the heart)
Symptoms: Chest pain (sharp, stabbing, or dull), Shortness of breath, Cough, Fever, Fatigue, Swelling in abdomen or legs, Irregular heartbeat
Medicines: Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs), Colchicine, Corticosteroids

Description: Structural heart defects present at birth
Symptoms: Cyanosis (bluish tint to skin, lips, or nails), Shortness of breath, Poor feeding or growth (in infants), Fatigue, Swelling in extremities
Medicines: Surgical repair, Medications to control symptoms (e.g., Diuretics, ACE inhibitors)

Description: Heart damage caused by rheumatic fever, resulting from untreated strep throat
Symptoms: Fatigue, Chest pain, Shortness of breath, Palpitations, Swollen or tender joints, Fever, Skin rash
Medicines: Antibiotics (to treat strep throat), Anti-inflammatory medications, Surgery (in severe cases)

Description: A mosquito-borne viral infection causing flu-like symptoms.
Symptoms: High fever, severe headache, pain behind the eyes, joint and muscle pain, rash
Medicines: Paracetamol, IV fluids

Description: A bacterial infection affecting the lungs, causing coughing and fatigue.
Symptoms: Persistent cough, chest pain, coughing up blood, fatigue, weight loss
Medicines: Rifampin, Isoniazid, Pyrazinamide, Ethambutol

Description: A bacterial infection causing severe diarrhea and dehydration.
Symptoms: Severe diarrhea, vomiting, dehydration, muscle cramps
Medicines: Doxycycline, Azithromycin, Ciprofloxacin

Description: A mosquito-borne parasitic disease causing fever and flu-like symptoms.
Symptoms: Fever, chills, sweating, headache, nausea, vomiting
Medicines: Chloroquine, Artemisinin-based combination therapy (ACT), Mefloquine

Description: A bacterial infection causing high fever, stomach pain, and weakness.
Symptoms: High fever, stomach pain, weakness, headache, rash
Medicines: Ciprofloxacin, Azithromycin, Ceftriaxone

Description: A viral infection affecting the liver, transmitted through bodily fluids.
Symptoms: Jaundice (yellowing of the skin and eyes), fatigue, abdominal pain, nausea, joint pain
Medicines: Tenofovir, Entecavir, Interferon

Description: A bacterial infection transmitted through contaminated water or soil.
Symptoms: High fever, headache, muscle aches, vomiting, jaundice
Medicines: Doxycycline, Penicillin, Ceftriaxone

Description: A viral infection transmitted through animal bites, affecting the nervous system.
Symptoms: Fever, headache, nausea, confusion, hallucinations, paralysis
Medicines: Rabies vaccine, Rabies immune globulin (RIG)

Description: A viral infection causing respiratory symptoms such as fever and cough.
Symptoms: Fever, cough, sore throat, runny or stuffy nose, body aches
Medicines: Oseltamivir (Tamiflu), Zanamivir (Relenza)

Description: A viral infection compromising the immune system, transmitted through bodily fluids.
Symptoms: Fever, fatigue, swollen lymph nodes, sore throat, rash, weight loss, night sweats
Medicines: Antiretroviral therapy (ART)

Description: A highly contagious viral infection causing fever and rash.
Symptoms: Fever, cough, runny nose, sore throat, inflamed eyes, rash
Medicines: Vitamin A supplementation

Description: An infection of the lungs, commonly caused by bacteria or viruses.
Symptoms: Cough with phlegm, fever, chills, shortness of breath, chest pain, fatigue
Medicines: Amoxicillin, Azithromycin, Ceftriaxone

Description: A viral infection transmitted by mosquitoes, causing joint pain and fever.
Symptoms: Fever, joint pain, headache, muscle pain, rash
Medicines: Paracetamol, Fluids for hydration

Description: A bacterial infection that can affect the skin, lungs, or gastrointestinal tract.
Symptoms: Fever, chills, cough, chest discomfort, nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain
Medicines: Ciprofloxacin, Doxycycline

Description: A viral infection transmitted by mosquitoes, linked to birth defects.
Symptoms: Fever, rash, joint pain, conjunctivitis (red eyes), muscle pain
Medicines: Supportive care

Description: A viral infection causing severe diarrhea, primarily affecting children.
Symptoms: Severe diarrhea, vomiting, fever, abdominal pain
Medicines: Oral rehydration solution (ORS), Rotavirus vaccine

Description: A viral infection leading to gastroenteritis, characterized by vomiting and diarrhea.
Symptoms: Nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, stomach pain, fever, headache
Medicines: Supportive care, Fluids for hydration

Description: A viral infection common in children, causing fever and sores on the hands, feet, and mouth.
Symptoms: Fever, sore throat, rash on hands, feet, and mouth, loss of appetite
Medicines: Supportive care, Pain relievers

Description: A bacterial infection leading to muscle stiffness and spasms.
Symptoms: Stiffness in jaw muscles (lockjaw), stiffness in neck muscles, difficulty swallowing, muscle stiffness and spasms
Medicines: Tetanus vaccine, Tetanus immune globulin (TIG)

Description: A bacterial infection causing severe coughing fits.
Symptoms: Severe coughing fits, whooping sound when coughing, vomiting after coughing
Medicines: Azithromycin, Clarithromycin

Description: An inflammation of the eye, commonly caused by viruses or bacteria.
Symptoms: Redness in the white of the eye or inner eyelid, increased tearing, itching, burning sensation in the eyes
Medicines: Antibiotic eye drops or ointments, Antihistamine eye drops

Description: A parasitic infection causing intense itching and skin rash.
Symptoms: Intense itching, rash (often between fingers, wrists, elbows, or knees), sores or crusts from scratching
Medicines: Permethrin cream, Antihistamines

Description: A bacterial infection transmitted by ticks, causing rash and flu-like symptoms.
Symptoms: Rash (bull's-eye pattern), fever, chills, fatigue, muscle and joint aches
Medicines: Doxycycline, Amoxicillin

Description: A bacterial infection transmitted from animals to humans, causing fever and joint pain.
Symptoms: Fever, sweats, fatigue, joint and muscle pain, headache, loss of appetite, swelling of the liver or spleen
Medicines: Doxycycline, Rifampicin, Gentamicin

Description: A bacterial infection of the eye, leading to blindness if left untreated.
Symptoms: Eye discharge, itchiness, irritation, blurred vision, sensitivity to light
Medicines: Azithromycin, Tetracycline

Description: A bacterial infection causing diarrhea and abdominal pain.
Symptoms: Diarrhea (often bloody), stomach cramps, nausea, vomiting, fever
Medicines: Supportive care, Fluids for hydration

Description: A parasitic infection affecting the digestive system, causing diarrhea.
Symptoms: Diarrhea, greasy stools, stomach cramps, bloating, nausea, dehydration
Medicines: Metronidazole, Tinidazole

Description: A chronic bacterial infection causing skin lesions and nerve damage.
Symptoms: Skin lesions (discolored patches or nodules), numbness or loss of sensation in affected areas, muscle weakness
Medicines: Rifampicin, Dapsone, Clofazimine

Description: A highly contagious viral infection causing itchy rash and fever.
Symptoms: Rash (itchy red spots that become blisters), fever, headache, fatigue
Medicines: Acyclovir, Antihistamines

Description: A viral infection transmitted by mosquitoes, causing fever and jaundice.
Symptoms: Fever, headache, muscle aches, backache, loss of appetite, nausea, vomiting, jaundice
Medicines: Yellow fever vaccine, Supportive care

Description: A viral infection transmitted by mosquitoes, usually mild with symptoms like fever and rash.
Symptoms: Fever, rash, joint pain, conjunctivitis (red eyes), muscle pain
Medicines: Supportive care, Pain relievers

Description: A parasitic infection transmitted by mosquitoes, causing swelling and skin changes.
Symptoms: Swelling of limbs (lymphedema), thickening of skin (elephantiasis), fever, chills, pain
Medicines: Diethylcarbamazine (DEC), Ivermectin, Albendazole

Description: A parasitic infection transmitted by sandflies, affecting the skin and internal organs.
Symptoms: Skin sores (ulcers), fever, weight loss, swollen spleen and liver, anemia
Medicines: Sodium stibogluconate, Amphotericin B

Description: A bacterial infection typically transmitted from animals to humans, causing flu-like symptoms.
Symptoms: High fever, headache, fatigue, muscle aches, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea
Medicines: Doxycycline, Ciprofloxacin

Description: A severe form of dengue fever, characterized by bleeding and plasma leakage.
Symptoms: Symptoms of dengue fever, bleeding (nosebleeds, bleeding gums), abdominal pain, vomiting blood, liver enlargement, circulatory system failure
Medicines: Fluid replacement therapy, Blood transfusion

Description: A viral infection primarily affecting birds but can spread to humans, causing respiratory symptoms.
Symptoms: Fever, cough, sore throat, muscle aches, headache, difficulty breathing, pneumonia
Medicines: Oseltamivir (Tamiflu), Zanamivir (Relenza)

Description: A viral infection transmitted by mosquitoes or contact with infected animals, causing fever and flu-like symptoms.
Symptoms: Fever, headache, muscle pain, joint pain, weakness, vomiting, red eyes, abdominal pain, liver damage
Medicines: Ribavirin, Vaccine for livestock

Description: A viral infection transmitted by mosquitoes, causing fever and neurological symptoms.
Symptoms: Fever, headache, body aches, skin rash, swollen lymph nodes, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, neurological symptoms
Medicines: Supportive care, Pain relievers

Description: A parasitic infection transmitted by triatomine bugs, leading to chronic heart and digestive problems.
Symptoms: Swelling at the site of infection, fever, fatigue, body aches, rash, swollen glands, eyelid swelling, liver and spleen enlargement, irregular heartbeat, digestive problems
Medicines: Benznidazole, Nifurtimox

Description: A fungal infection caused by inhaling spores, leading to flu-like symptoms and pneumonia.
Symptoms: Fatigue, cough, fever, shortness of breath, headache, night sweats, muscle aches, joint pain, rash
Medicines: Fluconazole, Itraconazole, Amphotericin B

Description: A viral infection causing swelling of the salivary glands and flu-like symptoms.
Symptoms: Fever, headache, muscle aches, swollen salivary glands (parotitis), fatigue
Medicines: Supportive care, Pain relievers

Description: Metabolic disorder characterized by high blood sugar levels
Symptoms: Increased thirst, Frequent urination, Extreme hunger, Unintended weight loss, Fatigue, Blurred vision, Slow-healing sores or frequent infections
Medicines: Insulin therapy (multiple types), Oral antidiabetic medications (Metformin, Sulfonylureas), Blood sugar monitoring

Description: Inherited disorder causing inability to metabolize phenylalanine
Symptoms: Intellectual disability, Developmental delays, Behavioral problems, Hyperactivity, Seizures, Skin rashes, Musty odor in urine, Eczema
Medicines: Low-protein diet (restricted phenylalanine intake), Phenylalanine-free formula, Medications to manage symptoms and complications

Description: Genetic disorder impairing ability to metabolize galactose
Symptoms: Jaundice, Liver enlargement, Poor feeding, Vomiting, Diarrhea, Failure to thrive, Lethargy, Cataracts (if untreated)
Medicines: Galactose-free diet, Close monitoring and treatment of complications (if present)

Description: Genetic disorder affecting branched-chain amino acid metabolism
Symptoms: Sweet-smelling urine, Poor feeding, Vomiting, Lethargy, Developmental delay, Neurological symptoms (seizures, tremors, coma), Maple syrup-like odor of sweat and urine
Medicines: Dietary restriction of branched-chain amino acids, Thiamine supplementation (in some cases)

Description: Inherited disorder causing copper accumulation in the liver and other organs
Symptoms: Jaundice, Abdominal pain and swelling, Fatigue, Weakness, Loss of appetite, Nausea, Vomiting, Neurological symptoms (tremors, difficulty walking, speech problems)
Medicines: Chelating agents (D-penicillamine, Trientine), Zinc supplements (to prevent copper absorption), Liver transplant (in severe cases)

Description: Genetic disorder affecting amino acid metabolism, leading to elevated homocysteine levels
Symptoms: Intellectual disability, Eye problems (near-sightedness, dislocated lens), Skeletal abnormalities (tall stature, scoliosis), Blood clots, Heart problems, Stroke
Medicines: Vitamin B6 (Pyridoxine), Folic acid supplements, Vitamin B12 (Cobalamin), Dietary restriction of methionine and homocysteine-rich foods

Description: Inherited disorder resulting from deficiency of enzyme glucocerebrosidase
Symptoms: Enlarged spleen and liver, Anemia, Low platelet count, Bone pain and fractures, Easy bruising, Fatigue, Delayed growth and development
Medicines: Enzyme replacement therapy (Imiglucerase, Velaglucerase alfa, Taliglucerase alfa), Substrate reduction therapy (Miglustat)

Description: X-linked inherited disorder causing deficiency of enzyme alpha-galactosidase A
Symptoms: Pain and burning sensations in hands and feet (acroparesthesia), Skin lesions (angiokeratomas), Gastrointestinal symptoms, Corneal opacities, Heart and kidney problems
Medicines: Enzyme replacement therapy (Agalsidase alfa, Agalsidase beta), Pain management, Supportive care

Description: Genetic disorder resulting from deficiency of enzyme acid alpha-glucosidase
Symptoms: Muscle weakness (especially in legs, arms, and trunk), Poor muscle tone (hypotonia), Enlarged heart (cardiomegaly), Breathing difficulties, Delayed motor development
Medicines: Enzyme replacement therapy (Alglucosidase alfa), Respiratory support, Physical therapy, Occupational therapy

Description: Inherited disorder leading to accumulation of homogentisic acid in the body
Symptoms: Dark urine that turns black on exposure to air, Joint stiffness and pain (due to deposition of homogentisic acid), Ochronosis (blue-black discoloration of connective tissues)
Medicines: Symptomatic relief (Pain management), Dietary restriction of tyrosine and phenylalanine

Description: Progressive neurodegenerative disorder leading to memory loss and cognitive decline
Symptoms: Memory loss (especially recent memories), Difficulty in problem-solving, Confusion, Changes in mood or personality, Difficulty completing familiar tasks
Medicines: Cholinesterase inhibitors (Donepezil, Rivastigmine), Memantine, Antipsychotics (for behavioral symptoms)

Description: Neurodegenerative disorder affecting movement and motor function
Symptoms: Tremors (usually starting in hands), Slowed movement (bradykinesia), Muscle stiffness, Impaired balance and coordination, Speech changes, Rigid facial expression
Medicines: Levodopa/carbidopa, Dopamine agonists (Pramipexole, Ropinirole), MAO-B inhibitors, COMT inhibitors

Description: Autoimmune disease affecting the central nervous system
Symptoms: Fatigue, Numbness or weakness in limbs, Blurred or double vision, Tingling or pain in parts of the body, Impaired coordination or balance, Cognitive changes
Medicines: Corticosteroids (for acute exacerbations), Disease-modifying therapies (Interferons, Glatiramer acetate)

Description: Chronic disorder characterized by recurrent seizures
Symptoms: Seizures (varying types and severity), Temporary confusion, Staring spells, Uncontrollable jerking movements, Loss of consciousness
Medicines: Antiepileptic drugs (Phenytoin, Carbamazepine, Valproic acid, Lamotrigine)

Description: Recurrent severe headaches often accompanied by nausea and sensitivity to light
Symptoms: Throbbing or pulsating headache (often on one side), Nausea, Vomiting, Sensitivity to light, Sound, or smells, Visual disturbances (aura)
Medicines: Pain relievers (Ibuprofen, Acetaminophen), Triptans, Antiemetics, Preventive medications (Beta-blockers, Anticonvulsants)

Description: Progressive neurodegenerative disease affecting nerve cells in the brain and spinal cord
Symptoms: Muscle weakness (usually starting in limbs), Muscle twitching or cramping, Difficulty in speaking, Swallowing difficulties, Impaired motor function
Medicines: Riluzole, Edaravone, Symptomatic treatments (Baclofen, Diazepam for spasticity)

Description: Inherited disorder causing progressive degeneration of nerve cells in the brain
Symptoms: Involuntary jerking or writhing movements (chorea), Muscle problems (rigidity, slow movements), Cognitive decline, Behavioral changes, Difficulty swallowing
Medicines: Tetrabenazine, Antipsychotics (for behavioral symptoms), Antidepressants

Description: Permanent movement disorders resulting from brain damage before, during, or shortly after birth
Symptoms: Abnormal muscle tone (spasticity, rigidity, or floppiness), Delayed development, Impaired coordination or balance, Speech and language difficulties
Medicines: Physical therapy, Occupational therapy, Muscle relaxants, Anticonvulsants

Description: Sudden interruption of blood supply to the brain, leading to brain damage
Symptoms: Sudden numbness or weakness in face, arm, or leg (usually on one side), Sudden confusion, Trouble speaking or understanding, Sudden vision problems, Severe headache
Medicines: Thrombolytics (tPA), Anticoagulants, Antiplatelet agents, Statins, Rehabilitation therapy

Description: Brain damage caused by an external force such as a blow to the head
Symptoms: Loss of consciousness, Headache, Nausea or vomiting, Dizziness or balance problems, Sensory changes (blurred vision, ringing in ears), Cognitive impairment
Medicines: Surgery (for severe cases), Rehabilitation therapy, Anticonvulsants, Antidepressants

Description: Chronic respiratory condition characterized by airway inflammation and bronchospasm
Symptoms: Wheezing, Shortness of breath, Chest tightness or pain, Coughing (especially at night or early morning), Difficulty sleeping
Medicines: Short-acting beta-agonists (Albuterol), Inhaled corticosteroids (Fluticasone, Budesonide), Long-acting beta-agonists (Formoterol, Salmeterol)

Description: Progressive lung disease causing airflow limitation
Symptoms: Shortness of breath (especially during physical activity), Chronic cough, Excessive sputum production, Wheezing, Chest tightness or pain
Medicines: Bronchodilators (Short-acting and Long-acting), Inhaled corticosteroids, Phosphodiesterase-4 inhibitors, Oxygen therapy, Pulmonary rehabilitation

Description: Inflammation of lung tissue caused by infection (bacterial, viral, or fungal)
Symptoms: Fever, Chills, Cough (with phlegm production), Shortness of breath, Chest pain, Rapid heartbeat, Fatigue, Confusion
Medicines: Antibiotics (for bacterial pneumonia), Antiviral medications (for viral pneumonia), Antifungal medications (for fungal pneumonia), Oxygen therapy

Description: Infectious bacterial disease primarily affecting the lungs
Symptoms: Persistent cough (usually with blood-tinged sputum), Weight loss, Fatigue, Fever, Night sweats, Loss of appetite, Chest pain, Shortness of breath
Medicines: Antibiotics (Isoniazid, Rifampicin, Ethambutol, Pyrazinamide), Directly Observed Therapy (DOT), Bacillus Calmette-Guérin (BCG) vaccine

Description: Viral infection causing respiratory illness, often seasonal
Symptoms: Fever or feeling feverish/chills, Cough, Sore throat, Runny or stuffy nose, Muscle or body aches, Headaches, Fatigue
Medicines: Antiviral medications (Oseltamivir, Zanamivir, Peramivir), Symptomatic relief (Pain relievers, Decongestants, Cough suppressants)

Description: Rapid onset of severe respiratory failure due to various underlying conditions
Symptoms: Severe shortness of breath, Rapid breathing, Low blood oxygen levels, Confusion or disorientation, Extreme fatigue or weakness
Medicines: Mechanical ventilation, Oxygen therapy, Medications to treat underlying cause (e.g., Antibiotics, Antifungals)

Description: Blockage of arteries in the lungs, usually by blood clots originating elsewhere
Symptoms: Sudden shortness of breath, Chest pain (usually sharp and worsened by deep breaths or coughing), Rapid or irregular heartbeat, Coughing up blood, Sweating
Medicines: Anticoagulants (Heparin, Warfarin, Direct oral anticoagulants), Thrombolytics, Oxygen therapy, Surgery (in severe cases)

Description: Genetic disorder causing thick, sticky mucus buildup in lungs and other organs
Symptoms: Persistent cough with thick sputum, Wheezing, Shortness of breath, Recurrent lung infections (pneumonia), Poor growth or weight gain
Medicines: Airway clearance techniques (Chest physiotherapy, Percussion and vibration), Bronchodilators, Inhaled antibiotics, Mucolytics, Enzyme supplements

Description: Chronic lung condition characterized by damaged and widened airways
Symptoms: Chronic cough with large amounts of sputum, Recurrent respiratory infections, Wheezing, Shortness of breath, Chest pain or tightness, Fatigue
Medicines: Antibiotics (for treating infections), Mucolytics, Bronchodilators, Chest physiotherapy, Surgical removal of damaged lung tissue

Description: Viral infection causing respiratory illness, particularly in infants and young children
Symptoms: Runny nose, Decreased appetite, Coughing, Sneezing, Fever, Wheezing or difficulty breathing, Rapid breathing
Medicines: Supportive care (Fluids, Rest), Oxygen therapy (for severe cases), Ribavirin (in severe cases)

Description: Genetic disorder causing thick, sticky mucus buildup in lungs and other organs
Symptoms: Persistent cough with thick sputum, Wheezing, Shortness of breath, Recurrent lung infections (pneumonia), Poor growth or weight gain
Medicines: Airway clearance techniques (Chest physiotherapy, Percussion and vibration), Bronchodilators, Inhaled antibiotics, Mucolytics, Enzyme supplements

Description: Inherited disorder causing progressive degeneration of nerve cells in the brain
Symptoms: Involuntary jerking or writhing movements (chorea), Muscle problems (rigidity, slow movements), Cognitive decline, Behavioral changes, Difficulty swallowing
Medicines: Tetrabenazine, Antipsychotics (for behavioral symptoms), Antidepressants

Description: Genetic disorder causing developmental and intellectual delays
Symptoms: Intellectual disability, Low muscle tone (hypotonia), Upward slanting eyes with small folds of skin at inner corners (epicanthal folds), Flat facial profile
Medicines: Early intervention programs, Educational support, Speech therapy, Occupational therapy

Description: Progressive muscle-wasting disease caused by genetic mutation
Symptoms: Progressive muscle weakness, Difficulty walking, Frequent falls, Gait abnormalities, Enlarged calves, Muscle contractures, Heart problems, Breathing difficulties
Medicines: Corticosteroids (Prednisone, Deflazacort), Physical therapy, Mobility aids, Respiratory support

Description: Genetic disorder impairing blood clotting ability
Symptoms: Excessive bleeding from minor injuries or surgery, Easy bruising, Joint pain or swelling (hemarthrosis), Blood in urine or stool, Nosebleeds
Medicines: Clotting factor replacement therapy, Desmopressin (DDAVP), Antifibrinolytic medications

Description: Genetic disorder causing abnormal hemoglobin production and red blood cell shape
Symptoms: Pain crises (sudden and severe pain), Anemia, Fatigue, Jaundice, Swelling of hands and feet (dactylitis), Frequent infections, Delayed growth and development
Medicines: Pain management (analgesics, opioids), Hydroxyurea, Blood transfusions, Antibiotics

Description: Genetic disorder leading to progressive destruction of nerve cells in the brain
Symptoms: Developmental delay, Loss of motor skills, Seizures, Blindness, Deafness, Difficulty swallowing, Progressive intellectual disability
Medicines: Supportive care (Symptom management), Physical therapy, Occupational therapy

Description: Genetic disorder causing accumulation of cystine in cells and tissues
Symptoms: Kidney problems (renal Fanconi syndrome), Growth failure, Muscle weakness, Photophobia (sensitivity to light), Poor appetite, Vomiting, Delayed puberty
Medicines: Cysteamine (to reduce cystine levels), Supportive care (fluid and electrolyte replacement)

Description: Inherited disorder causing inability to metabolize phenylalanine
Symptoms: Intellectual disability, Developmental delays, Behavioral problems, Hyperactivity, Seizures, Skin rashes, Musty odor in urine, Eczema
Medicines: Low-protein diet (restricted phenylalanine intake), Phenylalanine-free formula, Medications to manage symptoms and complications
